text.title: Review of Detection Methods of Static Eccentricity for Interior Permanent Magnet Synchronous Machine
text.author: Anmol Aggarwal, Elias G. Strangas
text.head: 3. Fault Signals for Detection
text.p: This section discuss the signals used for fault detection for the methods proposed. Signals are generated such that the fault detection is more clear.
text.head: 3.1. Commanded Voltages Method
text.p: The difference in the voltages between healthy and faulty cases is directly proportional to the difference in the flux linkages of healthy and faulty case. The difference between the flux linkages is significant in certain range of the current. The difference is maximum at the point shown in Figure 4. Therefore, for fault detection the machine should be operated as close as possible to point of maximum separation.

The minimum difference in current levels is chosen once measurable difference in the voltages is recorded, because increased difference in current levels decreases peak prominence.
text.head: 3.3. Harmonics in Voltage and Current Signals
text.p: The first 15 harmonics present in IAP (Instantaneous Active Power) are used for analysis for fault detection which was extracted using FFT (Fast Fourier Transform). The harmonic that shows the maximum separation between the healthy and faulty cases is used for analysis. The machine is operated at the same operating conditions as it is operated for commanded voltages method.
